Sentencas: This paper presents recent activities of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division and associated research advances in Canada, China, France, Germany, Poland, and Romania on programs and major initiatives on large-scale hydrogen production and utilization.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: Germany and France have made significant advances in high temperature steam electrolysis (HTSE).
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: Germany is going to demonstrate a 3-kW steam electrolyzer and 100-kW Hybrid Sulfur Cycle powered by solar energy soon.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: France operated several HTSE 25-cell stacks at various operating points.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: Recently, a HTSE packaged system has been built, containing this 25-cell stack and other Balance of Plant components.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: At 700 degrees C, this system produces 1.2 Nm(3)/h of H-2 with a total electrical consumption of 3.9 kWh/Nm(3), achieving 92% of efficiency (electrical consumption of the system vs HHV of the produced hydrogen).
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: It demonstrates that a 150 degrees C heat source temperature is sufficient for the steam generation, and that a slightly exothermic operating mode of the stack is sufficient to preheat the inlet gas up to 700 degrees C and compensate the heat losses of the system.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: China has also made significant progress in developing the HTSE process at a hydrogen production rate of 105 dm(3)/h and the thermochemical Sulfur Iodine (SI) cycle at the rate of 60 dm(3)/h, which already achieved the goal of China's HTR-PM Demonstration Nuclear Power Plant Project.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: The components and facilities were developed and tested in Tsinghua University.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: Romania is collaborating with Canada on nuclear hydrogen production with the thermochemical Cu-Cl cycle.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: The individual unit operations of the Cu-Cl cycle have been verified experimentally.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: Research on integration of a laboratory scale system to produce 3 kg of hydrogen per day is underway at the University of Ontario Institute of Technology in Oshawa, Ontario.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: Poland has developed advanced simulation capabilities for Solid Oxide Fuel/Electrolysis Cells for hydrogen peak energy storage as well as laboratory scale experiments focused on solid oxide and molten carbonate fuel cells.
Titulo: Progress of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division on international hydrogen production programs

Sentencas: This paper presents a review of activities of members of the IAHE Nuclear Hydrogen Division in these six countries.
